author: jwasinger
content:
something I want to get clarification on:  I am assuming with the decoupling of BAL from block body, we cannot assume that `NewPayload` will always contain the BAL.  If it doesn't, we need to fetch the BAL from the network, which implies that the new devp2p messages for sending BALs will be required for devnet 2.

Is this the case?  if so, this is a potentially substantial change as it changes the semantics of `NewPayload`: the payload is not actually verifiable until we can retrieve the corresponding BAL.

author: b.hartnett
content: My understanding is that newPayload will/should always contain the BAL (after Amsterdam). The BAL is removed from the block body but not from the execution payload. BALs will also be available to speed up sync but only within the BAL retention period which should align with the WSP. There is a new devp2p eth protocol version (eth/70) which includes new message types/flows to request and receive a list of BALs by bal hashes separate from the block body.

author: jwasinger
content:
that was my understanding until the call yesterday, where it was claimed that the CLs aren't obligated to persist the BAL for blocks beyond the head and also that we will need to add engine api methods to retrieve BALs from the EL.  And now my mental model of it is a bit confused.

<@792404665068158998> maybe you could clarify here?

author: sky.cactus
content: It does seem that any data needs to be retained at least for a while in order for it to be relied on and useful.  Something that exists on the network for 12 seconds or less is not meaningful.  At best, something that exists for 12 seconds could be thought of as an optimization for the narrow case of people who are on reliable high bandwidth connections following head.

author: nero_eth
content: The CL does store the execution payload it replaces the BAL with the BAL root to deduplicate data. The same is done for transactions. Thus, if the CL wants to provide the execution payload to another peer, it must first fetch the BAL from the EL, replace BAL root with the actual BAL and only then send the block.
